Package socialmedia

Class Comment

  • java.lang.Object
    • socialmedia.Post
      • socialmedia.Comment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Comment
extends Post

    Comment

    This class consists of the specific methods and attributes of a Comment, some of the other methods and attributes of a Comment are inheritted from a Post. Therefore this class is responsible for the Comment specific methods and attributes.

    As a Comment inherits from a Post and thefore has access to all of a Post's attributes and methods. In addition to these, a Comment has a linkedPost attribute which refers to the Post which the comment has been placed on.

    The class itself has a static value for its SerialVersionUID used when serializing the platform.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Comment​(Account author, java.lang.String message, Post linkedPost)
      This is the constructor method for a Comment, it takes in the parameters author which refers to the account associated with the post, message which must be up to 100 characters long and a Post which the comment is associated with.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Comment

        public Comment​(Account author,
               java.lang.String message,
               Post linkedPost)
        throws InvalidPostException,
               HandleNotRecognisedException
        This is the constructor method for a Comment, it takes in the parameters author which refers to the account associated with the post, message which must be up to 100 characters long and a Post which the comment is associated with.
        Parameters:
        author - The account associated with the comment.
        message - The message contained in the comment.
        linkedPost - The Post which the comment has ben added on.
        Throws:
        InvalidPostException - Thrown when the message is longer than 100 characters.
        HandleNotRecognisedException - Thrown when the given account ahdnle does not exist in the system.
